laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum TSH concentration was determined by RIA at 27 mU/mL (normal range, 0.5–5) and more than 80 mU/mL (normal range, 0.5–5) during various evaluations.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: TSH was within normal range (2.3 mU/mL) at 6 months after treatment and undetectable by a second generation assay at 12 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Total T4 concentration was reported as 2.1 mg/dL (normal values, 4.2–12) and below the sensitivity of the methods at other times.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum total and free T4 were at the upper limits of the normal range at 12 months after treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Total T3 concentration was reported as 51 ng/dL (normal values, 100–210) and below the sensitivity of the methods at other times.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: T3 was within normal limits at 12 months after treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Thyroid uptake of a tracer dose of 131I was 4% at 1 h and decreased to 4%, 3%, and 2% at 2, 3, and 24 h, respectively.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No response to bovine TSH after administration, with uptake remaining low.

laboratory_examinations.date: A few months before first admission
laboratory_examinations.findings: Reported low total T4 (2.1 mg/dL) and T3 (51 ng/dL), T3 resin uptake was 22%, and the free T4 index was 1.6.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Changed to upper limits of normal range after 12 months of treatment.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Calcium, phosphorus, and alkaline phosphatase concentrations

laboratory_examinations.findings: Urinary iodine excretion was low (66 mg/L).
